column4: flexible :you had a running gnome before and now can boot safemode still ?
flexible :how did you install ? sudo apt-get install kubuntu-desktop ?
flexible :right, did you try dpkg repair ... from the recovery menu ? (have to choose netroot for dhcp in front, then enter exit at cmd-prompt, then choose
i'd rather just remove KDE and revert to GNOME
flexible :first make sure there are no unmet dependencies, then reconfigure your x, should boot then
alright
how do i do that DasEi
1)netroot just for inet-connect), enter exit 2) dpkg..blah, let it finish 3) rootprompt again : cp /etc/X11/xorg.conf /etc/X11/xorg_ba  && dpkg-reconfigure xserver-xorg
what is netroot
an option from the recovery (safemode) menu, know how to get there ?
nope
when machine starts sayin grub..., hit ESC (or left shift at newer grubs), then you can choose which kernel to boot >> safemode
okay i am at the safemode prompt
what do i type
you got that menu with the choices, like resume,dpkg.. and so on ?
no
so is that a busybox maybe ?
i'm running linux mint, which isn't strictly ubuntu
!mint | flexible
basics are same there, though
it seems to me you either are at a cmd-line after a starved gdm or at initramfs'es busbox
still around ?
